note.p: Education: Ipswich School (1767-1776); Caius College, Cambridge. BA (1781), MA (1815)

Career: Ordained Deacon (1782); ordained priest (1783); Curate of Coddenham and Barham, Suffolk (1782-1797); Vicar of Barham, Suffolk (1782-to his death in 1850); Rural Dean of Claydon; founded the order 'Strepsitera' in a paper to the Linnean Society (1811); wrote 'Introduction to entomology' with William Spence (1815); wrote 'Habits and instincts of animals' as a Bridgewater treatise (1830); died of old age
Memberships: FLS (one of the first); Entomological Society (Honorary President 1837)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1850 No 76 pp 1023-1026
References: W H Brock, 'The Selection of the Authors of the Bridgewater Treatises' in NR 1966 vol 21 pp 162-179
Notes: 'Saml Carlisle' is Samuel Goodenough, Bishop of Carlisle
